sen.j: 良尚入道親王（りょうしょうにゅうどうしんのう、元和 (日本)8年12月16日 (旧暦)（1623年1月16日） － 元禄6年7月5日 (旧暦)（1693年8月6日））は、江戸時代前期の京都曼殊院の門跡。
sen.e: Ryoshonyudo Shinno (January 16, 1623 - August 6, 1693) was the Monzeki (a head priest of temple who is a member of Imperial Family) of Kyoto Manju-in Temple in the early Edo period.

sen.e: He was conferred the title of Imperial Prince by the Imperial proclamation issued in August 1634 and in September, he entered the Buddhist priesthood at Manju-in Temple.

sen.j: 1646年（正保3年）3月には天台座主に任じられ、1656年（明暦2年）現在の京都御所近くにあった曼殊院を洛北一乗寺村へ移転し、伽藍を整備している。
sen.e: After he was appointed as the head priest of Tendai Sect in march 1646, he moved Manju-in Temple, which had been located at a place near to current Kyoto Imperial Palace, to Ichijoji village in Rakuhoku in 1656 and improved its garan (ensemble of temple buildings).

sen.e: He was known as a person of culture since he learned paintings from the brothers of Tanyu KANO and Naonobu KANO, practiced Ikenobo-school flower arrangement and was well versed in classical literature.
